components.description:
A seashell, as found at the beach. Generally depicted as an empty, spiraling, white seashell, as grown by a sea snail or home to a hermit crab. Positioned at various angles across platforms.

Often used for various content concerning beaches, ocean and ocean life, and summer fun.

Apple’s design previously resembled a clam shell, Microsoft’s a snail shell. Google’s was previously blue.
components.title: Spiral Shell

title: Spiral Shell

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A seashell found at the beach. It has a spiral shape, and may become home to a hermit crab. Spiral Shell was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 http://emojipedia.org/spiral-shell/
emoji_net_data.name: spiral shell

bn:00099977a: In the shape of a coil
In the shape of a helix.
In the shape of a coil.
In the shape of a helix

bn:00094133v: To move along the path of a spiral or helix.

bn:00069946n: The sea, the world ocean, or simply the ocean, is the connected body of salty water that covers 70.8% of the Earth's surface.
A large body of salty water. (Major seas are known as oceans.)
A sea is a large body of saline water usually connected with an ocean.
A division of an ocean or a large body of salt water partially enclosed by land
The body of water covering most of Earth
A body of salt water that is smaller than an ocean and generally in proximity to a continent.

bn:00009263n: A lat, narrow strip of sand, gravel or pebbles along the shoreline of a body of water (ocean, river, lake).
An area of sand sloping down to the water of a sea or lake
A beach is a landform along the coast of an ocean, sea, lake, or river.
The shore of a body of water, especially when sandy or pebbly.
Landform along the shoreline of an ocean, sea, lake, or river

bn:00070052n: The shell of a marine organism
A hard outer layer of a marine animal, found on beaches
A seashell or sea shell, also known simply as a shell, is a hard, protective outer layer created by an animal that lives in the sea.
The empty shell of a marine mollusk
Hard, protective outer layer created by an animal that lives in the sea
A seashell, also known as a sea shell, or simply as a shell, is the common name for a hard, protective outer layer, a shell that was created by a sea creature, a marine organism.
